title: Fragment, "Departure for the Hunt", ca. 1810
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave foundation
inscribed: The title "DEPART POUR LA CHASSE" on a rock at the left, at the right a signpost indicating the towns of "LILLEBONNE", "MESNIL" and "VALASSE" and the signature F. PIETERS on a rock at the right.
dimensions: Warp: 80.5 cm (31 3/4 in.) Weft: 82.5 cm (32 1/2 in.). Both selvedges present. Pattern: height of repeat: 63 cm (24 3/4 in.). Instructions given indicating where to sew lengths together to form a slightly offset straight repeat indicated by the word 'ici' at each edge.
description: Two scenes arranged horizontally; the first of a cart drawn by two horses carrying four hunters with dogs and three attendants walking alongside; the second of hunters and dogs at work in a marsh and in the fields. In red on white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, "Departure for the Hunt", ca. 1810.
ca. 1810. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-77.
